hi all. I wanted to understand the scaling performance of multithreading. Say I have a function which calculate the root of a function repeatedly:
```using Base.Threads, Roots, BenchmarkTools

nthreads()
# 16

function singlethread()
    for i in 1:100000
        find_zero(x -> x^3 - x^2, 5.0)
    end
end

@btime singlethread()
# 411.331 ms (2200000 allocations: 210.57 MiB)

function multithreads()
    @threads for i in 1:100000
        find_zero(x -> x^3 - x^2, 5.0)
    end
end
@btime multithreads()
# 68.632 ms (2200081 allocations: 210.58 MiB)```
So even though Iâ€™m using 16 threads, the scaling is only 5 times. Is this a normal behavior? If so, any chance I can improve the scaling like switching to `@spawn` or multiprocessing?
